page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY VILLAGES
page.content: {Coneythorpe}means{"Kings village"}it is named after a Danish King who lived in the village.{Coneythorpe}is about 3 miles from{Goldsborough.}There are about 36 houses, mostly new but some are over 200 years old. The land is owned by{Peter Harrison}but farmers rent it from him.There is a pub in the village called The{Tiger Inn}owned by the{Dysons. {Flaxby}has 32 houses,many are stone bungalows.It has not changed much over the last five years.There is a potato packing plant and a soft fruit farm. In 1640{Richard Hodgshen}left rents from 15acres of land near{Fewston}"for the benefit of a free school"The Lord of the{Manor}and{rector}being Trustees Early this century it was a shop,but was pulled down in 1930's,the Trust money then went to children who passed the entrance to{King James's School.
